Pediatrics & Neonatology

Best child hospital in Ranchi with complete, compassionate pediatric care from birth to adolescence

Overview

The Paediatrics Department at Raj Hospitals delivers comprehensive, state-of-the-art healthcare services tailored for children from birth up to sixteen years. With dedicated pediatricians, skilled nurses, and child life experts, the department ensures the highest standards in child healthcare, diagnosis, compassionate support, preventive medicine, and advanced treatments. Specialized services range from pediatric and neonatal intensive care to immunization and surgical management for various childhood diseases and health concerns.

Why Choose Our Pediatrics Department

  • State-of-the-art Pediatric Intensive Care Unit (PICU) and Neonatal ICU (NICU)
  • Paediatric and neonatal ventilatory support
  • Isolation wards for infection control
  • 24x7 emergency pediatric care
  • Immunization clinic and vaccination services

Key Facilities

State-of-the-art PICU and NICU
Paediatric and neonatal ventilatory support
Isolation wards for infection control
24x7 emergency pediatric care
Child-friendly outpatient environment
Immunization clinic and vaccination services

Treatments We Offer

Comprehensive pediatric care with advanced techniques

Respiratory Support (Ventilation & Surfactant)

Advanced management for respiratory distress in newborns requiring ventilators and surfactant therapy.

Neonatal Jaundice (DVET)

Management of severe newborn jaundice with double volume exchange transfusion (DVET).

Neonatal Sepsis & Convulsions

Critical care for life-threatening newborn infections and treatment for neonatal convulsions.

Common Pediatric Ailments

Comprehensive care for pneumonia, pediatric asthma, allergic disorders, GI diseases, and childhood convulsions.

Patient Success Stories

Real stories of healing and recovery from our Pediatrics department

Life-saving Neonatal Intensive Care

Patient: Local Family

Our newborn suffered severe respiratory distress and was admitted to the NICU immediately after birth. The timely use of ventilatory support and surfactant therapy saved our baby's life.

Outcome: Full recovery; healthy and thriving child

Complex Pediatric Sepsis Managed

Patient: Amit's Parents

Our infant was diagnosed with neonatal sepsis and convulsions. The pediatric team provided critical treatments and constant support, resulting in a swift and remarkable recovery.

Outcome: Safe discharge and stable health of the child

Frequently Asked Questions

Common questions about Pediatrics & Neonatology

What are the signs of serious pediatric illness?

Signs include high fever, breathing difficulties, seizures, lethargy, poor feeding, and persistent vomiting or diarrhea.

Do you provide vaccinations at the hospital?

Yes, our immunization clinic provides all essential vaccines as per the National Immunization Schedule and special vaccines as needed.

How do you manage severe infections in newborns?

We use intensive monitoring, IV antibiotics, and advanced NICU facilities for treating neonatal sepsis and related complications.

Are you equipped to manage respiratory problems in infants?

Our NICU and PICU are fully equipped for ventilatory support and advanced respiratory therapies for infants and children.

Have More Questions?

Get in touch with our Pediatrics specialists

Our team will respond within 24 hours
